programme.title: Deadly Instincts
programme.desc: Beyond the 50/50 coin toss of fight or flight, survival really is a numbers game. Your threats stack up: primed predators, child killers, cruel nature. Whether through courage, wisdom, strength, or by leveraging super-powers, the survivors make it - against all odds..

programme.title: Deadly Instincts
programme.desc: In the animal world, mating is big business. It's key to passing on genes, and ultimately species survival. These are the stories of dedication, intimacy and ruthlessness that make up the game of love. The stakes are high, and winning is everything..

programme.title: Wild, Smart and Deadly
programme.desc: In the wild, animals face life or death battles every day, from escaping deadly predators to fighting off fierce rivals. Sometimes brute force isn‚Äôt enough to prevail. Survival can depend on death-defying acrobatics, secret senses and hidden weapons - the extraordinary superpowers that help animals survive.

programme.title: Deadly Instincts
programme.desc: The law of the wild is kill, or be killed - but how do different creatures execute this most grisly of tasks? From solo slayers like tigers, who rely on stealth, speed and strength, to team players like orca, who use their intelligence to work together and kill against the odds, this is a new and unique exploration of how animals kill.

programme.title: Lake Tanganyika: Africa's Blue Heart
programme.desc: Lake Tanganyika, one of the largest lakes on earth combines two very different yet equally magical worlds: an untouched wilderness along the shores, home to chimpanzees, elephants and antelopes and a spectacularly diverse underwater universe. The lake shares many of the ocean‚Äôs characteristics. Glorious sunsets, occasional storms with terrifying waves and waters filled with sardines, colorful fish, crabs and even sponges.

programme.title: The Incredible Pol Farm
programme.desc: It‚Äôs summer in Michigan, which means time to bale some hay! It‚Äôs a grueling process, but Dr. Pol, Charles, and Ben manage to mow their hayfield, which is the first step in baling. But a surprise rainstorm could ruin this year‚Äôs hay haul. They hope for sun, so their crop doesn‚Äôt spoil before they can bale. Meanwhile, the Pol‚Äôs bring in their next animal to the farm ‚Äì an emu!.

programme.title: The Incredible Pol Farm
programme.desc: It's the county fair season! The Pol‚Äôs plan to get at least two cows and six sheep at the auction, but they have a lot to do before that can happen. First up, they must install a new perimeter fence. Charles and Ben think they are off to a good start, but when Dr. Pol points out how sneaky sheep can be, their workload doubles. Meanwhile, Beth is hoping for a goat at the small animal auction.

programme.title: Africa's Blood River
programme.desc: The film examines the classic crocodile/wildebeest confrontation at the Mara River in Tanzania. Filmed with a number of innovative techniques..

programme.title: Wild Vietnam
programme.desc: Travel to southern Vietnam's tropical habitats, home to gibbons and playful macaques, green sea turtles, and Asian black bears. Reintroduced Siamese crocodiles roam the Bau Sau wetlands. The vast Mekong Delta boasts small-clawed otters and thousands of migrating birds, from openbill storks to Oriental darters.

programme.title: Untamed Philippines
programme.desc: We start on the tiny island of Batan, meeting a unique viper and a ubiquitous but also giant, land crab. Luzon is the main island of the Philippines. We drop in to Mindoro to see the most endangered large mammal in the Philippines, the tamaraw.

programme.title: Untamed Philippines
programme.desc: Moving from turtles of the Palawan coast to the unique National Marine Park at Tubbataha, to meet giants, whale sharks and manta rays. We also see how people can mediate between people and wildlife as we join a snake hunting team catching and translocating a deadly Samar cobra.

programme.title: Lake Tanganyika: Africa's Blue Heart

The lake shares many of the ocean‚Äôs characteristics. Glorious sunsets, occasional storms with terrifying waves and waters filled with sardines, colorful fish, crabs and even sponges.

programme.title: Africa's Hidden Wonders
programme.desc: Blanketed by mists and bordered by dense jungles filled with rampaging beasts, Rwanda is a country cloaked in mystery. This tropical land of fire and forest lies at the crest of the mountainous backbone of Africa. Home to the African great apes and some of the continent's most mysterious landscapes - from the Virunga volcanoes, to rich rainforest to exploding lakes.

programme.title: Africa's Hidden Wonders
programme.desc: Ethiopia is a wilderness of extremes - from lush lakes to towering peaks - where life has had to adapt in order to survive. This ancient land has cradled life since the dawn of time, and beyond the scorched deserts lie fortified mountains that conceal natural treasure troves of wildlife found nowhere else on Earth.

programme.title: Africa's Hidden Wonders
programme.desc: The Sahara, the largest desert in the world: an extreme environment covering a vast swathe of northern Africa. With hardly any water or food available, on the surface, it appears to be a desolate empty land. But hidden beyond the parched exterior, specialist species have adapted to this harsh landscape..

programme.title: Africa's Blood River
programme.desc: The film examines the classic crocodile/wildebeest confrontation at the Mara River in Tanzania. Filmed with a number of innovative techniques..

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: There‚Äôs no time to waste when the emergency calls come in. Dr. Pol is called out to two calvings, Dr. Lisa skillfully stitches a Chihuahua after a dog fight, Dr. Brenda gives special attention to a calf needing extra nutrients, and Dr. Nicole gives a duck a pedicure. With one call right after the other, the team‚Äôs day is just as wild as the Michigan weather.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: The Pol‚Äôs welcome a new foal to the family as the warmer spring temperatures turn up the heat on animal emergencies. Dr. Brenda‚Äôs knee snaps while saving the life of a mare. Dr. Pol is called out to treat five calves that are struggling to grow. Dr. Nicole plucks quills from a curious Chihuahua, and Dr. Lisa treats a cat with a blocked bladder.

programme.title: Africa's Hunters
programme.desc: The Mwamba lion pride dominates the west bank of the river in Zambia's Luangwa Valley. But this family is facing an uncertain future.

programme.title: Africa's Hunters
programme.desc: Milo is a young cub in the mighty Mwamba pride, which rules a territory on the west bank of the Luangwa River. 20-strong it's ruled by the notorious Punks, a coalition of three strong brothers, it's the largest pride for miles around, giving Milo the best start in life. But, in lion society, cubs are the glue that binds a pride.
